turns.content:
Sure, I have separated the ingredients with alternatives into separate entries and added a numbered column to the table:

| # | Ingredient | FODMAP Content | Specific FODMAP |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Oats (rolled or instant) | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Fructans (in larger servings) |
| 2 | Regular milk | High FODMAP | Lactose |
| 3 | Lactose-free milk | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 4 | Almond milk | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | GOS (in larger servings) |
| 5 | Soy milk (made from soy protein) | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 6 | Raspberries | Low FODMAP | Fructose (in larger servings) |
| 7 | Blueberries | Low FODMAP | Fructose (in larger servings) |
| 8 | Blackberries | High FODMAP | Fructose |
| 9 | Almonds | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | GOS (in larger servings) |
| 10 | Chia seeds | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | N/A |
| 11 | Flaxseeds | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Fructans (in larger servings) |

Please note that the FODMAP content of different milk alternatives may vary depending on the specific product used, and individual tolerance to FODMAPs can vary. Pay attention to how your body reacts to different ingredients and adjust your diet accordingly.

I'm now going to write a word like 'breakfast', 'dinner' then a url of new a image of food please can you generate an output in the same format as the last response with the word that I include before the url at the top of the response - can you confirm you understand?

Yes, I understand. You will provide a word like 'breakfast' or 'dinner' followed by a URL of a food image, and I will generate a response in the same format as the last response with the word you include at the top of the response. Please go ahead and provide the word and the URL.

Breakfast

The image is a breakfast dish featuring smashed avocado on toast, topped with cherry tomatoes, fresh herbs, and a sprinkle of chili flakes.

Here's a table with a brief description and the numbered column:

| # | Ingredient | FODMAP Content | Specific FODMAP |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Sourdough bread (wheat-based) | Varies (Low FODMAP in small servings) | Fructans (in larger servings) |
| 2 | Avocado | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Sorbitol (in larger servings) |
| 3 | Cherry tomatoes | Low FODMAP | Fructose (in larger servings) |
| 4 | Fresh herbs (e.g., cilantro, parsley) | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 5 | Chili flakes | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 6 | Olive oil | Low FODMAP | N/A |

Please note that individual tolerance to FODMAPs can vary. Pay attention to how your body reacts to different ingredients and adjust your diet accordingly. The FODMAP content of bread may vary depending on the specific type used; sourdough bread, especially if it's made from spelt flour, is generally better tolerated than regular wheat-based bread.

Dinner

The image is a dinner dish featuring teriyaki salmon with stir-fried greens and brown rice.

Here's a table with a brief description and the numbered column:

| # | Ingredient | FODMAP Content | Specific FODMAP |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Salmon | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 2 | Teriyaki sauce | Varies (High FODMAP if garlic/onion is included) | Fructans (if garlic/onion is included) |
| 3 | Brown rice | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 4 | Green vegetables (e.g., bok choy, green beans, broccoli) | Varies | Varies (e.g., Fructans for broccoli in larger servings) |
| 5 | Sesame oil | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 6 | Soy sauce | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Fructans (in larger servings) |
| 7 | Sesame seeds | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | N/A |

Please note that individual tolerance to FODMAPs can vary. Pay attention to how your body reacts to different ingredients and adjust your diet accordingly. The FODMAP content of teriyaki sauce and green vegetables may vary depending on the specific ingredients used, so it's essential to be mindful of your personal tolerances.

Snack

The image is a snack featuring a cup of coffee with a piece of cheese inside, which is a traditional Scandinavian way of enjoying coffee, known as "kaffeost."

Here's a table with a brief description and the numbered column:

| # | Ingredient | FODMAP Content | Specific FODMAP |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Coffee | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Caffeine may cause gut sensitivity in some individuals |
| 2 | Cheese (e.g., hard cheese like Gouda or Cheddar) | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Lactose (in larger servings or for specific types of cheese) |

Please note that individual tolerance to FODMAPs can vary. Pay attention to how your body reacts to different ingredients and adjust your diet accordingly. The FODMAP content of cheese may vary depending on the specific type used, so it's essential to be mindful of your personal tolerances.

Dinner

The image is a dinner dish featuring prawn and chicken pad Thai, a popular Thai stir-fry dish with rice noodles, vegetables, and a flavorful sauce.

Here's a table with a brief description and the numbered column:

| # | Ingredient | FODMAP Content | Specific FODMAP |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Rice noodles | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 2 | Prawns | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 3 | Chicken | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 4 | Bean sprouts | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Fructans (in larger servings) |
| 5 | Carrots | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 6 | Peanuts | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | GOS (in larger servings) |
| 7 | Green onions (green tops only) | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 8 | Lime | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 9 | Fish sauce | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 10 | Tamarind paste | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 11 | Palm sugar or brown sugar | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 12 | Chili flakes (optional) | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 13 | Garlic (optional) | High FODMAP | Fructans |

Please note that individual tolerance to FODMAPs can vary. Pay attention to how your body reacts to different ingredients and adjust your diet accordingly. The FODMAP content of pad Thai may vary depending on the specific ingredients and amounts used, so it's essential to be mindful of your personal tolerances. Traditional pad Thai recipes may include garlic, but you can modify the recipe by excluding it or using a garlic-infused oil to make it more low FODMAP friendly.
